alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 26 at 10:37AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall on melting snowpack continues. * WHERE...A portion of DownEast Maine, including the following counties, Hancock and Washington. * WHEN...Until noon EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Significant ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1033 AM EST, the public reported heavy rain on melting snowpack in the advisory area. This is causing mainly urban and some small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Rain is ending but will continue to see urban poor drainage issues until temperatures fall below freezing later today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ellsworth, Bar Harbor, Bucksport, Blue Hill, Machias, Lubec, Eastport, Cherryfield, Deer Isle, Dedham, Jonesport, Castine, Steuben, Harrington, Perry, Pembroke, Jonesboro, Columbia Falls, Verona Island and Cutler. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
